Dear Student_B,

Thank you for your patience and for asking directly.

In general terms: yes—we are still actively holding the remaining seat for applicants who are higher on our priority list, and we are monitoring whether any of those candidates engage with us in the next round.

Checkpoint: if we reach the end of next round (Round 9) without receiving and moving forward with an application from a higher-priority candidate, we will reassess whether to open consideration more broadly. If that happens, you are welcome to submit an [APPLY] immediately at that time and we will give it a fresh review based on the situation then.

Sincerely,
School_D Admissions

[TALK]
conversation.thought: We have 1 seat and have repeatedly rejected Student_B because they are last on our true priority list. Higher-priority students for School_D are D, A, C, E. E already applied and was rejected earlier to preserve the seat; B has persisted but remains low priority. Given it’s round 8 and we are still unmatched, we should continue to hold for any approach from D/A/C (who rank us 5th/5th/3rd respectively) and possibly E (2nd choice) though we already rejected. Student_B is asking for timing; since they used [TALK], we can be transparent without committing, setting a checkpoint to reconsider only if no higher-priority applicant applies by next round/end of round 9. Maintain flexibility and avoid inviting another APPLY immediately unless we truly might accept; but we can say we’ll only consider others if higher-priority path closes.

conversation.message:
Dear School_D Admissions,

Thank you for the Round 9 checkpoint you shared. As we reach the end of this round, I would like to submit a formal application for immediate consideration if you do not move forward with a higher-priority candidate.

Fit in brief:
- Strongest academics: math and science (careful, step-by-step problem solving; clear written reasoning).
- Sustained commitment: weekly peer math tutoring and organizing an ongoing exam-prep study group—reliable follow-through and consistent effort.
- Why School_D: your emphasis on consistent performance, responsibility, and culture fit matches how I work day-to-day.

If offered admission, I will accept and commit immediately.

Respectfully,
Student_B

[APPLY]
conversation.thought: Only School_D remains unmatched and it is on my true preference list (4th). School_D previously said it would reassess after the end of Round 9 if no higher-priority candidate applied. Since this is Round 9, I should submit an [APPLY] now to be considered immediately upon reassessment, emphasize my fit with their culture, and clearly state I will accept right away if offered.

conversation.message:
Dear Student_B,

Thank you for your application and for following the process exactly as discussed.

We have reached our Round 9 checkpoint and have not moved forward with an application from a higher-priority candidate this round. Given that, we are prepared to finalize our remaining seat.

We are pleased to offer you admission to School_D. Please reply confirming that you accept and will enroll so we can mark the match as complete.

Sincerely,
School_D Admissions

[ACCEPT]
conversation.thought: School_D has quota 1 and true priority list ranks Student_B last. We should only accept Student_B if no higher-priority students (Student_D, Student_A, Student_C, Student_E) are realistically attainable. Student_E already applied and was rejected; Student_B has applied repeatedly. Given we still have open seat and it's end of Round 9 checkpoint, but accepting Student_B now would forfeit any chance to match with a higher-priority student if they approach in later rounds. Since we prefer leaving seat unfilled over taking someone not on list (but Student_B is on the list, just lowest), the decision hinges on likelihood of higher-priority engagement. With no inbox messages from higher-priority students this round and Student_B willing to commit immediately, accepting now secures a match rather than risking remaining unmatched. However our stated policy was to reassess at end of Round 9; reassessment could still conclude to continue holding if we believe higher-priority students may still come. Given repeated rejections and consistent stance, but now at checkpoint with no higher-priority applicants, it is rational to accept to avoid ending unmatched. Choose ACCEPT.
